intro: Cybianthus gracillimus, commonly known as the slender cybianthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Cybianthus gracillimus is often found in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to survive in low-nutrient environments.
